intro: Blinkworthia convolvuloides, commonly known as the narrowleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and herbs characterized by their showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a twining herb with slender, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple, opening in the morning and closing by midday. Blinkworthia convolvuloides is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
